067/**
068 * JSON-RPC Client for <b>Bitcoin Core</b>.
069 * <p>
070 * A strongly-typed wrapper for a Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC client using the
071 * <a href="https://bitcoincore.org/en/doc/">Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC API</a>.
072 * <p>
073 * <a href="https://bitcoinj.org">bitcoinj</a> types are used where appropriate.
074 * For example, requesting a block hash will return a {@link org.bitcoinj.base.Sha256Hash}:
075 *
076 * <pre> {@code
077 * Sha256Hash hash = client.getBlockHash(342650);
078 * }</pre>
079 *
080 * Requesting a Bitcoin balance will return the amount as a {@link org.bitcoinj.base.Coin}:
081 *
082 * <pre> {@code
083 * Coin balance = client.getBalance();
084 * }</pre>
085 *
086 * This version is written to be compatible with Bitcoin Core 0.20 and later. If used with
087 * Omni Core (an enhanced version of Bitcoin Core with Omni Protocol support) Omni Core 0.11.0 or later is required.
088 * <p>
089 * Note that according to <a href="https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/2960">Issue #2960: Support JSON-RPC 2.0</a> Bitcoin Core
090 * does not correctly follow the JSON-RPC 2.0 specification.
091 * @see org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcClient
092 * @see <a href="https://bitcoincore.org/en/doc/">Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC API reference</a>
093 * @see <a href="https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/2960">Bitcoin Core Issue #2960: Support JSON-RPC 2.0</a>
094 * <p>
095 * <b>This is still a work-in-progress and the API will change.</b>
096 *
097 */
098public class BitcoinClient extends JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection implements ChainTipClient {
099    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BitcoinClient.class);
100
101    private static final int THREAD_POOL_SIZE = 5;
102
103    private static final int SECOND_IN_MSEC = 1000;
104    private static final int RETRY_SECONDS = 5;
105    private static final int MESSAGE_SECONDS = 30;
106
107    public static final int BITCOIN_CORE_VERSION_MIN = 200000;              // Minimum Bitcoin Core supported (tested) version
108    public static final int BITCOIN_CORE_VERSION_DESC_DEFAULT = 230000;     // Bitcoin Core version that DEFAULTS to descriptor wallets
109
110    // TODO: Replace NetworkParameters with Network/BitcoinNetwork once we upgrade to bitcoinj 0.17 (once it is released)
111
112    private Network network;
113    private ExecutorService executorService;
114
115    private int serverVersion = 0;    // 0 means unknown serverVersion
116    private boolean isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = false;
117    private boolean isAddressIndexEnabled;
118
119    public BitcoinClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
120        super(sslSocketFactory, JsonRpcMessage.Version.V2, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
121        this.network = network;
122        if (network != null) {
123            initExecutor();
124        }
125    }
126
127    @Deprecated
128    public BitcoinClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, NetworkParameters netParams, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
129        this(sslSocketFactory, netParams.network(), server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
130    }
131
132    private void initExecutor() {
133        mapper.registerModule(new RpcClientModule(network));
134        ThreadFactory threadFactory = new BitcoinClientThreadFactory(new Context(), "Bitcoin RPC Client");
135        // TODO: Tune and/or make configurable the thread pool size.
136        // Current pool size of 5 is chosen to minimize simultaneous active RPC
137        // calls in `bitcoind` -- which is not designed for serving multiple clients.
138        executorService = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(THREAD_POOL_SIZE, threadFactory);
139    }
140
141    // TODO: Reconcile this constructor mode with {@link #waitForServer(int)}
142    /**
143     * Incubating constructor that doesn't require a {@link Network}.
144     * <p>
145     * When using this constructor, it is recommended that {@link #getNetParams()} be called after construction
146     * and before any other methods are called, to allow the Bitcoin network type to be initialized.
147     * @param sslSocketFactory Custom socket factory
148     * @param server URI of the Bitcoin RPC server
149     * @param rpcuser Username (if required)
150     * @param rpcpassword Password (if required)
151     */
152    public BitcoinClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
153        this(sslSocketFactory, (Network) null, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Incubating constructor that doesn't require a {@link Network}.
158     * <p>
159     * When using this constructor, it is recommended that {@link #getNetParams()} be called after construction
160     * and before any other methods are called, to allow the Bitcoin network type to be initialized.
161     * @param server URI of the Bitcoin RPC server
162     * @param rpcuser Username (if required)
163     * @param rpcpassword Password (if required)
164     */
165    public BitcoinClient(URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
166        this((SSLSocketFactory) SSLSocketFactory.getDefault(), (Network) null, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Construct a BitcoinClient from Network, URI, user name, and password.
171     * @param network Correct Network Parameters for destination server
172     * @param server URI of the Bitcoin RPC server
173     * @param rpcuser Username (if required)
174     * @param rpcpassword Password (if required)
175     */
176    public BitcoinClient(Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
177        this((SSLSocketFactory) SSLSocketFactory.getDefault(), network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
178    }
179
180    @Deprecated
181    public BitcoinClient(NetworkParameters netParams, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
182        this(netParams.network(), server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * Construct a BitcoinClient from an RPCConfig data object.
187     * @param config Contains URI, user name, and password
188     */
189    public BitcoinClient(RpcConfig config) {
190        this(config.network(), config.getURI(), config.getUsername(), config.getPassword());
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * Get network parameters
195     * <p>
196     * Traditionally the Bitcoin network has been required as a constructor parameter and required to match
197     * the mode of the server. However, to simplify client configuration we have added a constructor
198     * that doesn't require a {@link NetworkParameters}. This changes some assumptions about how {@code BitcoinClient} works.
199     * Previously, no JSON-RPC I/O calls would be performed unless something was explicitly requested -- which
200     * also gave users of {@code BitcoinClient} the ability to call {@link #waitForServer(int)}
201     * before calling any RPCs.
202     * <p>
203     * Until further improvements/changes are made, if you use one of the constructors that does not specify a
204     * {@code NetworkParameters} you should call {@code getNetParams()} as soon as possible after calling the constructor
205     * (especially before calling any JSON-RPC I/O methods except {@link #waitForServer(int)}).
206     * @return network parameters for the server
207     */
208    public synchronized NetworkParameters getNetParams() {
209        return NetworkParameters.of(getNetwork());
210    }
211
212    public synchronized Network getNetwork() {
213        if (network == null) {
214            network = getNetworkFromServer().join();
215            initExecutor();
216        }
217        return network;
218    }
219
220    @Override
221    public ExecutorService getDefaultAsyncExecutor() {
222        return executorService;
223    }
224    
225    /**
226     * Shutdown our thread pool, etc.
227     *
228     * @throws InterruptedException if one happens
229     */
230    @Override
231    public void close() throws InterruptedException {
232        // TODO: See shutdownAndAwaitTermination method in the ExecutorService JavaDoc for
233        // how to correctly implement this.
234        executorService.shutdown();
235        boolean successfullyTerminated = executorService.awaitTermination(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
236        if (!successfullyTerminated) {
237            log.warn("timeout while closing");
238        }
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Get a (cached after first call) serverVersion number
243     * @return serverVersion version of bitcoin server node
244     */
245    synchronized int getServerVersion() {
246        if (serverVersion == 0) {
247            try {
248                serverVersion = getNetworkInfo().getVersion();
249            } catch (IOException e) {
250                throw new RuntimeException(e);
251            }
252            if (serverVersion < BITCOIN_CORE_VERSION_MIN) {
253                throw new RuntimeException("Unsupported server version");
254            }
255        }
256        return serverVersion;
257    }
258
259    private CompletableFuture<Network> getNetworkFromServer() {
260        return getBlockchainInfoMap().thenApply(info -> {
261            Network network;
262            switch((String) info.get("chain")) {
263                case "main":
264                    network = BitcoinNetwork.MAINNET;
265                    break;
266                case "test":
267                    network = BitcoinNetwork.TESTNET;
268                    break;
269                case "signet":
270                    network = BitcoinNetwork.SIGNET;
271                    break;
272                case "regtest":
273                    network = BitcoinNetwork.REGTEST;
274                    break;
275                default:
276                    throw new RuntimeException("Server returned unrecognized Bitcoin network");
277
278            }
279            return network;
280        });
281    }
282
283    /**
284     * Return BlockchainInfo as a Map (this avoids use of RpcClientModule and a circular dependency on NetworkParameters)
285     * Note that we also can't use our ThreadFactory or ExecutorService because they depend on NetworkParameters as well,
286     * and are not created until after we know what network we are on.
287     * @return  getblockchaininfo response JSON as a Map
288     */
289    private CompletableFuture<Map<String, Object>> getBlockchainInfoMap() {
290        return supplyAsync(() -> send("getblockchaininfo"), r -> new Thread(r).start());
291    }
292
293    /**
294     * Test if address index is enabled, caching the result of the first successful check
295     *
296     * @return true if enabled, false if not enabled
297     * @throws JsonRpcException an exception other than 1 of the two expected exceptions is thrown
298     * @throws IOException something else went wrong
299     */
300    public synchronized boolean isAddressIndexEnabled() throws JsonRpcException, IOException {
301        if (!isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested) {
302            try {
303                AddressBalanceInfo info = getAddressBalance(getTestAddress());
304                isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = true;
305                isAddressIndexEnabled = true;
306            } catch (JsonRpcErrorException ee) {
307                // If method not found, the method we use for the test isn't even present, so definitely
308                // no address index support is available
309                if (ee.getError().getCode() == JsonRpcError.Error.METHOD_NOT_FOUND.getCode()) {
310                    isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = true;
311                    isAddressIndexEnabled = false;
312                } else {
313                    // Some other, unexpected exception, throw it
314                    throw ee;
315                }
316            } catch (JsonRpcStatusException se) {
317                // If the method is there and it returns an error of "Address index not enabled" then we also
318                // know that no address index support is available
319                if (se.getMessage().equals("Address index not enabled")) {
320                    isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = true;
321                    isAddressIndexEnabled = false;
322                } else if ( se.jsonRpcCode == JsonRpcError.Error.METHOD_NOT_FOUND.getCode()) {
323                    // It looks like the behavior changed in Bitcoin Core v23.0 and we end up here rather than in the  JsonRpcErrorException handler above
324                    isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = true;
325                    isAddressIndexEnabled = false;
326                } else {
327                    // Some other, unexpected exception, throw it
328                    throw se;
329                }
330            }
331        }
332        return isAddressIndexEnabled;
333    }
334
335    private Address getTestAddress() {
336        BitcoinNetwork network = (BitcoinNetwork) getNetwork();
337        switch (network) {
338            case MAINNET:
339                return LegacyAddress.fromBase58( "1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNa", network);
340            case TESTNET:
341            case REGTEST:
342            case SIGNET:
343            default:
344                return LegacyAddress.fromBase58( "moneyqMan7uh8FqdCA2BV5yZ8qVrc9ikLP", network);
345        }
346    }
347
348    // TODO: Make this an async method that returns CompletableFuture.
349    // TODO: Consider renaming this method "connect"
350    // TODO: Consider having this method automatically get the Bitcoin Network, Server Version, RegTest mining address, etc once connection is made
351    /**
352     * Wait until the server is available.
353     *
354     * Keep trying, ignoring (and logging) a known list of exception conditions that may occur while waiting for
355     * a `bitcoind` server to start up. This is similar to the behavior enabled by the `-rpcwait`
356     * option to the `bitcoin-cli` command-line tool.
357     *
358     * @param timeout Timeout in seconds
359     * @return true if ready, false if timeout or interrupted
360     * @throws JsonRpcException if an "unexpected" exception happens (i.e. an error other than what happens during normal server startup)
361     */
362    public Boolean waitForServer(int timeout) throws JsonRpcException {
363
364        log.debug("Waiting for server RPC ready...");
365
366        String status;          // Status message for logging
367        String statusLast = null;
368        int seconds = 0;
369        while (seconds < timeout) {
370            try {
371                Integer block = this.getBlockCount();
372                if (block != null) {
373                    log.debug("RPC Ready.");
374                    return true;
375                }
376                status = "getBlock returned null";
377            } catch (SocketException se) {
378                // These are expected exceptions while waiting for a server
379                if (se.getMessage().equals("Unexpected end of file from server") ||
380                        se.getMessage().equals("Connection reset") ||
381                        se.getMessage().contains("Connection refused") ||
382                        se.getMessage().equals("recvfrom failed: ECONNRESET (Connection reset by peer)")) {
383                    status = se.getMessage();
384                } else {
385                    throw new JsonRpcException("Unexpected exception in waitForServer", se) ;
386                }
387
388            } catch (EOFException ignored) {
389                /* Android exception, ignore */
390                // Expected exceptions on Android, RoboVM
391                status = ignored.getMessage();
392            } catch (JsonRpcStatusException e) {
393                // If server is in "warm-up" mode, e.g. validating/parsing the blockchain...
394                if (e.jsonRpcCode == -28) {
395                    // ...then grab text message for status logging
396                    status = e.getMessage();
397                } else {
398                    log.error("Rethrowing JsonRpcStatusException: ", e);
399                    throw e;
400                }
401            } catch (IOException e) {
402                // Ignore all IOExceptions
403                status = e.getMessage();
404            }
405            try {
406                // Log status messages only once, if new or updated
407                if (!status.equals(statusLast)) {
408                    log.info("Waiting for server: RPC Status: " + status);
409                    statusLast = status;
410                }
411                Thread.sleep(RETRY_SECONDS * SECOND_IN_MSEC);
412                seconds += RETRY_SECONDS;
413            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
414                log.error(e.toString());
415                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
416                return false;
417            }
418        }
419
420        log.error("waitForServer() timed out after {} seconds.", timeout);
421        return false;
422    }
423
424    /**
425     * Wait for RPC server to reach specified block height.
426     *
427     * @param blockHeight Block height to wait for
428     * @param timeout     Timeout in seconds
429     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
430     * @throws IOException network error
431     * @return True if blockHeight reached, false if timeout or interrupted
432     */
433    public Boolean waitForBlock(int blockHeight, int timeout) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
434
435        log.info("Waiting for server to reach block " + blockHeight);
436
437        int seconds = 0;
438        while (seconds < timeout) {
439            Integer block = this.getBlockCount();
440            if (block >= blockHeight) {
441                log.info("Server is at block " + block + " returning 'true'.");
442                return true;
443            } else {
444                try {
445                    if (seconds % MESSAGE_SECONDS == 0) {
446                        log.debug("Server at block " + block);
447                    }
448                    Thread.sleep(RETRY_SECONDS * SECOND_IN_MSEC);
449                    seconds += RETRY_SECONDS;
450                } catch (InterruptedException e) {
451                    log.error(e.toString());
452                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
453                    return false;
454                }
455            }
456        }
457
458        log.error("Timeout waiting for block " + blockHeight);
459        return false;
460    }
461
462
463    /**
464     * Tell the server to stop
465     * @return A status string
466     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
467     * @throws IOException network error
468     */
469    public String stop() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
470        return send("stop");
471    }
472
473    /**
474     * Returns the number of blocks in the longest block chain.
475     *
476     * @return The current block count
477     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
478     * @throws IOException network error
479     */
480    public Integer getBlockCount() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
481        return send("getblockcount");
482    }
483
484    /**
485     * Returns the hash of block in best-block-chain at index provided.
486     *
487     * @param index The block index
488     * @return The block hash
489     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
490     * @throws IOException network error
491     */
492    public Sha256Hash getBlockHash(Integer index) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
493        return send("getblockhash", Sha256Hash.class, index);
494    }
495
496    /**
497     * Returns information about a block with the given block hash.
498     *
499     * @param hash The block hash
500     * @return The information about the block (JSON/POJO object)
501     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
502     * @throws IOException network error
503     */
504    public BlockInfo getBlockInfo(Sha256Hash hash) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
505        // Use "verbose = true"
506        return send("getblock", BlockInfo.class, hash, true);
507    }
508
509    /**
510     * Returns information about a block with the given block hash.
511     *
512     * @param hash The block hash
513     * @return The information about the block (bitcoinj {@link Block} object)
514     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
515     * @throws IOException network error
516     */
517    public Block getBlock(Sha256Hash hash) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
518        // Use "verbose = false"
519        return send("getblock", Block.class, hash, false);
520    }
521
522    /**
523     * Mine blocks immediately (RegTest mode)
524     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.13.0
525     *
526     * @param numBlocks Number of blocks to mine
527     * @param address Address to send mined coins to
528     * @param maxtries How many iterations to try (or null to use server default -- currently 1,000,000)
529     * @return list containing block header hashes of the generated blocks
530     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
531     * @throws IOException network error
532     */
533    public List<Sha256Hash> generateToAddress(int numBlocks, Address address, Integer maxtries) throws IOException {
534        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, Sha256Hash.class);
535        return send("generatetoaddress", resultType, (long) numBlocks, address, maxtries);
536    }
537
538    /**
539     * Mine blocks immediately (RegTest mode)
540     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.13.0
541     *
542     * @param numBlocks Number of blocks to mine
543     * @param address Address to send mined coins to
544     * @return list containing block header hashes of the generated blocks
545     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
546     * @throws IOException network error
547     */
548    public List<Sha256Hash> generateToAddress(int numBlocks, Address address) throws IOException {
549        return generateToAddress(numBlocks,address, null);
550    }
551
552    public List<String> listWallets() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
553        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, String.class);
554        return send("listwallets", resultType);
555    }

557    public LoadWalletResult createWallet(String name, Boolean disablePrivateKeys, Boolean blank) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
558        return createWallet(name, disablePrivateKeys, blank, null, null, null, null, null);
559    }
560
561    public LoadWalletResult createWallet(String name, Boolean disablePrivateKeys, Boolean blank, String passPhrase,
562                                         Boolean avoidReuse) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
563        return send("createwallet", LoadWalletResult.class, name, disablePrivateKeys, blank, passPhrase, avoidReuse);
564    }
565
566    // To use all these params server must be "recent"
567    public LoadWalletResult createWallet(String name, Boolean disablePrivateKeys, Boolean blank, String passPhrase,
568                                         Boolean avoidReuse, Boolean descriptors, Boolean loadOnStartup,
569                                         Boolean externalSigner) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
570        return send("createwallet", LoadWalletResult.class, name, disablePrivateKeys, blank, passPhrase, avoidReuse, descriptors, loadOnStartup, externalSigner);
571    }
572
573    public UnloadWalletResult unloadWallet() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
574        return unloadWallet(null, null);
575    }
576
577    public UnloadWalletResult unloadWallet(String name, Boolean loadOnStartup) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
578        return send("unloadwallet", UnloadWalletResult.class, name, loadOnStartup);
579    }

581    /**
582     * Creates a new Bitcoin address for receiving payments, linked to the default account "".
583     *
584     * @return A new Bitcoin address
585     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
586     * @throws IOException network error
587     */
588    public Address getNewAddress() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
589        return getNewAddress(null);
590    }
591
592    /**
593     * Creates a new Bitcoin address for receiving payments.
594     *
595     * @param label The label name for the address to be linked to.
596     * @return A new Bitcoin address
597     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
598     * @throws IOException network error
599     */
600    public Address getNewAddress(String label) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
601        return send("getnewaddress", Address.class, label);
602    }
603    
604    /**
605     * Return the private key from the server.
606     *
607     * Note: must be in wallet mode with unlocked or unencrypted wallet.
608     *
609     * @param address Address corresponding to the private key to return
610     * @return The private key
611     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
612     * @throws IOException network error
613     */
614    public ECKey dumpPrivKey(Address address) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
615        return send("dumpprivkey", ECKey.class, address);
616    }
617
618    /**
619     * Import a private key into the server's wallet
620     *
621     * @param privateKey An ECKey (containing a private key)
622     * @param label The server-side label for the key
623     * @param rescan Rescan the blockchain to find transactions for this key
624     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
625     * @throws IOException network error
626     */
627    public void importPrivKey(ECKey privateKey, String label, boolean rescan) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
628        send("importprivkey", Void.class, privateKey.getPrivateKeyEncoded(this.getNetwork()).toBase58(), label, rescan);
629    }
630    
631    /**
632     * Creates a raw transaction spending the given inputs to the given destinations.
633     *
634     * Note: the transaction inputs are not signed, and the transaction is not stored in the wallet or transmitted to
635     * the network.
636     *
637     * @param inputs  The outpoints to spent
638     * @param outputs The destinations and amounts to transfer
639     * @return The hex-encoded raw transaction
640     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
641     * @throws IOException network error
642     */
643    public String createRawTransaction(List<Outpoint> inputs, Map<Address, Coin> outputs)
644            throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
645        return send("createrawtransaction", inputs, outputs);
646    }
647
648    /**
649     * Signs inputs of a raw transaction using the wallet. Arguments 2 and 3 of the RPC are currently
650     * not supported, which means UTXOs not currently in the blockchain can't be used and `sighashtype`
651     * defaults to `ALL`.
652     *
653     * @param unsignedTransaction The hex-encoded raw transaction
654     * @return The signed transaction and information whether it has a complete set of signature
655     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
656     * @throws IOException network error
657     * @since Bitcoin Core v0.17
658     */
659    public SignedRawTransaction signRawTransactionWithWallet(String unsignedTransaction) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
660        return send("signrawtransactionwithwallet", SignedRawTransaction.class, unsignedTransaction);
661    }
662
663    /**
664     * Get a "raw" transaction (which we use to construct a bitcoinj {@code Transaction})
665     * @param txid Transaction ID/hash
666     * @return bitcoinj Transaction
667     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
668     * @throws IOException network error
669     */
670    public Transaction getRawTransaction(Sha256Hash txid) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
671        String hexEncoded = send("getrawtransaction", txid);
672        byte[] raw = HexUtil.hexStringToByteArray(hexEncoded);
673        return new Transaction(NetworkParameters.of(network), ByteBuffer.wrap(raw));
674    }
675
676    /**
677     * Get a "raw" transaction as JSON (which we map to a RawTransactionInfo POJO)
678     * @param txid Transaction ID/hash
679     * @return RawTransactionInfo POJO
680     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
681     * @throws IOException network error
682     */
683    public RawTransactionInfo getRawTransactionInfo(Sha256Hash txid) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
684        return send("getrawtransaction", RawTransactionInfo.class, txid, 1);
685    }
686
687    /**
688     * Submit a raw transaction to local node and network
689     *
690     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.19
691     * @param tx The raw transaction
692     * @param maxFeeRate  Reject transactions whose fee rate is higher than this value, expressed in BTC/kB.
693     *                    Set to 0 to accept any fee rate.
694     * @return SHA256 Transaction ID
695     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
696     * @throws IOException network error
697     */
698    public Sha256Hash sendRawTransaction(Transaction tx, Coin maxFeeRate) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
699        return send("sendrawtransaction", Sha256Hash.class, tx, maxFeeRate);
700    }

703     * Submit a raw transaction to local node and network
704     *
705     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.19
706     * @param hexTx The raw transaction as a hex-encoded string
707     * @param maxFeeRate  Reject transactions whose fee rate is higher than this value, expressed in BTC/kB.
708     *                    Set to 0 to accept any fee rate.
709     * @return SHA256 Transaction ID
710     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
711     * @throws IOException network error
712     */
713    public Sha256Hash sendRawTransaction(String hexTx, Coin maxFeeRate) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
714        return send("sendrawtransaction", Sha256Hash.class, hexTx, maxFeeRate);
715    }

723     * @throws IOException network error
724     */
725    public Sha256Hash sendRawTransaction(Transaction tx) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
726        return sendRawTransaction(tx, (Coin) null);

946    }

948    /**
949     * List wallet transactions.
950     * @param label Return transactions matching this address label, use "*" to return all transactions. {@code null} will use the server default ({@code "*"})
951     * @param count Maximum number of transactions to return. {@code null} will use the sever default number (10)
952     * @return A list of wallet transactions
953     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
954     * @throws IOException network error
955     */
956    public List<BitcoinTransactionInfo> listTransactions(String label, Integer count) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
957        return listTransactions(label, count, null, null);
958    }
959    /**
960     * List wallet transactions
961     * @param label Return transactions matching this address label, use "*" to return all transactions. {@code null} will use the server default ({@code "*"})
962     * @param count Maximum number of transactions to return. {@code null} will use the sever default number (10)
963     * @param skip Number of transactions to skip. {@code null} will use the server default (0)
964     * @param includeWatchOnly Include transactions to/from watch-only addresses. {@code null} will use the server default, which is  ({@code true}) for watch-only wallets, {@code false} otherwise.
965     * @return A list of wallet transactions
966     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
967     * @throws IOException network error
968     */
969    public List<BitcoinTransactionInfo> listTransactions(String label, Integer count, Integer skip, Boolean includeWatchOnly) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
970        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, BitcoinTransactionInfo.class);
971        return send("listtransactions", resultType, label, count, skip, includeWatchOnly);
972    }

998     * and on which ports.

1006        return send("getzmqnotifications", resultType);

1008
1009    /**
1010     * Returns list of related addresses
1011     * Also useful for finding all change addresses in the wallet
1012     * @return a lost of address groupings
1013     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1014     * @throws IOException network error
1015     */
1016    public List<List<AddressGroupingItem>>  listAddressGroupings() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1017        // TODO: I'm not sure how to make Jackson mapping work automatically here.
1018        List<List<List<Object>>> raw = send("listaddressgroupings");
1019        List<List<AddressGroupingItem>> result = new ArrayList<>();
1020        for (List<List<Object>> rawGrouping : raw) {
1021            List<AddressGroupingItem> grouping = new ArrayList<>();
1022            for (List<Object> addressItem : rawGrouping) {
1023                AddressGroupingItem item = new AddressGroupingItem(addressItem, getNetwork());
1024                grouping.add(item);
1025            }
1026            result.add(grouping);
1027        }
1028        return result;
1029    }
1030
1031    /**
1032     * Returns a human-readable list of available commands.
1033     * <p>
1034     * Bitcoin Core 0.10+ returns a categorized list of commands including blank lines
1035     * and header lines.
1036     *
1037     * @return The list of commands as string
1038     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1039     * @throws IOException network error
1040     */
1041    public String help() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1042        return help(null);
1043    }
1044
1045    /**
1046     * Returns a human-readable list of available commands.
1047     *
1048     * @return The response as a stream of one {@link String} for each line
1049     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1050     * @throws IOException network error
1051     */
1052    public Stream<String> helpAsStream() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1053        return lines(help());
1054    }
1055
1056    /**
1057     * Returns a human-readable list of available commands.
1058     *
1059     * @return The response as a list one {@link String} for each line
1060     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1061     * @throws IOException network error
1062     */
1063    public List<String> helpAsLines() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1064        return helpAsStream().collect(Collectors.toList());
1065    }
1066
1067    /**
1068     * Returns a human-readable list of available commands.
1069     *
1070     * @return The response as a list one {@link MethodHelpEntry} for each method
1071     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1072     * @throws IOException network error
1073     */
1074    public List<MethodHelpEntry> helpAsMethodEntries() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1075        return helpAsStream()
1076                .filter(this::isMethodEntry)
1077                .map(MethodHelpEntry::new)
1078                .collect(Collectors.toList());
1079    }
1080
1081    /**
1082     * Returns helpful information for a specific command.
1083     *
1084     * @param command The name of the command to get help for
1085     * @return The help text
1086     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1087     * @throws IOException network error
1088     */
1089    public String help(String command) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1090        return send("help", command);
1091    }
1092
1093    /**
1094     * Returns a list of available commands.
1095     *
1096     * Commands which are unavailable will not be listed, such as wallet RPCs, if wallet support is disabled.
1097     *
1098     * @return The list of commands
1099     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1100     * @throws IOException network error
1101     */
1102    public List<String> getCommands() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1103        return helpAsMethodEntries().stream()
1104                .map(MethodHelpEntry::getMethodName)
1105                .collect(Collectors.toList());
1106    }
1107
1108    private Stream<String> lines(String string) {
1109        // In JDK 11 this can be replaced by String::lines
1110        return Stream.of(string.split("\n"));
1111    }
1112
1113    private boolean isMethodEntry(String line) {
1114        // Filter out blank and header lines
1115        return !line.isEmpty() && !line.matches("== (.+) ==");
1116    }
1117
1118    /**
1119     * Checks whether a command exists.
1120     *
1121     * This is done indirectly, by using {help(String) help} to get information about the command, and if information
1122     * about the command is available, then the command exists. The absence of information does not necessarily imply
1123     * the non-existence of a command.
1124     *
1125     * @param command The name of the command to check
1126     * @return True if the command exists
1127     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1128     * @throws IOException network error
1129     */
1130    public Boolean commandExists(String command) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1131        return !help(command).contains("help: unknown command");
1132    }
1133
1134    /**
1135     * Permanently marks a block as invalid, as if it violated a consensus rule.
1136     *
1137     * @param hash The block hash
1138     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.10
1139     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1140     * @throws IOException network error
1141     */
1142    public void invalidateBlock(Sha256Hash hash) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1143        send("invalidateblock", hash);
1144    }

1146    /**
1147     * Removes invalidity status of a block and its descendants, reconsider them for activation.
1148     * <p>
1149     * This can be used to undo the effects of {link invalidateBlock(Sha256Hash) invalidateBlock}.
1150     *
1151     * @param hash The hash of the block to reconsider
1152     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.10
1153     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1154     * @throws IOException network error
1155     */
1156    public void reconsiderBlock(Sha256Hash hash) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1157        send("reconsiderblock", hash);
1158    }

1171        return send("getchaintips",resultType);

1226
1227    // Bitcore/Omni transaction for getting non-wallet address UTXO Info
1228    public List<AddressUtxoInfo> getAddressUtxos(List<Address> addressList) throws JsonRpcException, IOException {
1229        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, AddressUtxoInfo.class);
1230        return send("getaddressutxos", resultType, new AddressRequest(addressList));
1231    }

1233}
